title: [BUG] CurrentCulture should reflect the regional format defined by the user
body: Before UWP, CurrentCulture reflected the Regional Settings format and CurrentUICulture reflected the Display Language. That behavior is good but has changed in UWP (both now reflect the same thing: Display Language), making it unecessarely hard for developers to correctly respect the user's preference when displaying dates and numbers.

comments.body: It seems that people behind this UWP feature isn't aware of how users are using Windows. I know personally of a few multi-national companies (10 000+ users) that standardize on Windows clients with English as display language. Then change location and regional format to match actual country.
I'm glad you like my work around, but let me point you to a new and improved version of it: https://www.pedrolamas.com/2017/05/03/cultureinfo-changes-in-uwp-part-2/

So this is why Microsoft's own apps such as Weather fails to respect users regional settings. It is quite common that users prefer display language such as US English and that this is different from regional settings.
